intro: Gomphosia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered gomphosia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are simple and opposite, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually pale green to yellowish and are followed by small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds.
